title: Devin December '24 Product Update (Part 2) - General Availability
description: Devin is now generally available for all engineering teams at $500/month. The update made Devin ~10% faster and ~10% more cost-efficient, with fixes for crashing/stuck issues. Added customization options for session filters, PR comment controls, and Slack notifications. Introduced pinned and auto-updated Knowledge features.

community_feedback.quote: Interesting as tech, but skeptical about the replacement narrative compared to human engineers.
Described as a collaborative AI teammate that can be added to repos and Slack, useful for code reviews, refactoring, and catching bugs, but not a replacement for human engineers.

title: Changelist: December 2024 - Cascade Improvements
description: December 2024 brought a series of updates and refinements to Windsurf and Codeium for Enterprise, focused on improving Cascade on Windsurf. The update included various enhancements to the Cascade feature.

community_feedback.quote: A cascade of errors, bugs, problems and lack of support started to happen in December 2024.
Subscribed to Pro Tier after being impressed during trial, but found Cascade 'practically unusable' after upgrading - a frustrating experience.
Excellent file structure creation for projects, ability to create and edit multiple files, faster response times, better context understanding compared to competitors.

title: Version 0.44 - Agent Updates, Chat Tabs, Custom Modes, and Performance Improvements
description: Released December 17, 2024. Introduced chat tabs for parallel conversations, custom modes (beta), built-in modes (Agent and Ask), faster indexing for similar codebases (Cursor repo now indexes in <1 minute vs 20 minutes), sound notifications on chat completion, usage-based cost visualization, and new onboarding flow. Also included memory and performance improvements, new themes, UI improvements, and MCP enhancements.

community_feedback.quote: 0.44 is amazing! The new and improved agent is just something else - more consistent and less buggy. GPT-4o + Claude integration is great.
This update broke my cursor entirely. I can't open it - app restarted to 'take effects' but wouldn't open properly.
Almost every single message in composer is causing breaking changes for me. Regretted upgrading and asked about alternatives like Cline or Windsurf.
Version 0.44.8 feels really good now - keeping scope minimal and modular, better project evolution understanding with updated context documents.
YOLO Mode is amazing! Composer can write code, execute it in terminal, and fix bugs automatically without user input.

title: Version 0.67.0 - Watch Files Feature and Bedrock Nova Support
description: Released December 6, 2024. Added watch files feature - run 'aider --watch-files' to watch for instructions in source files using AI comments (// ... or # ... comments starting/ending with 'AI'). Support for new Amazon Bedrock Nova models. When /run or /test have non-zero exit codes, pre-fill 'Fix that' into next prompt. Added Ctrl-Z support for process suspension.

title: Version 0.66.0 - PDF Support and Voice Input Device Selection
description: Released December 1, 2024. Added PDF support for Sonnet and Gemini models. Added --voice-input-device to select audio input device for voice recording. Added --timeout option to configure API call timeouts. Set cwd to repo root when running shell commands. Added Ctrl-Up/Down keyboard shortcuts for per-message history navigation.
